required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Compulsive Exercise Group Therapy for Eating Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Control Trial Study Evaluating a Compulsive Exercise Group for Adolescent Inpatients With Eating Disorders

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to generate hypotheses about whether a group intervention is effective in reducing motivation to compulsive exercise and/or eating disorder psychopathology when compared with a control group. This will be explored through a Randomized Control Trial.

study_design_info.masking_description: There is an external statistician who will assess the outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire

arm_group.description: Treatment as usual is offered. This includes; individual therapy, group therapy, dietetic support, occupational therapy, nursing and psychiatry, excluding the NEAT group.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Treatment as usual and NEAT group
arm_group.description: Treatment as usual is offered. This includes; individual therapy, group therapy, dietetic support, occupational therapy, nursing and psychiatry, alongside NEAT group.

intervention.intervention_name: Newbridge Eating disorders Activity Treatment group
intervention.description: A compulsive exercise cognitive-behavioural based group, for children and adolescents diagnosed with an eating disorder. It was devised for eating disorders including Anorexia Nervosa, Bulimia Nervosa and Other Specified Feeding or Eating Disorder. This treatment is semi-structured and problem-oriented, which focuses on tackling the factors and processes that maintain compulsive exercise behaviour.
intervention.arm_group_label: Treatment as usual and NEAT group

intervention.description: Multi-disciplinary eating disorder treatment (including; psychiatry, individual therapy, group therapy, dietetic support, occupation therapy and nursing excluding NEAT group).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Inpatients at Newbridge House
- Aged 11-18
- Primary diagnosis of any form of eating disorder
- Females
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously received NEAT group at Newbridge House
- Aged under 10 years
- Severe learning disability
- Inpatients without compulsive exercise behaviours
- Day patients
- Co-morbid psychosis
- Males
